results.title: Memphis Belle
results.creator_credit: Bountiful Company Ltd, David Puttnam, Catherine Wyler and Michael Caton-Jones
results.brief_description: The Memphis Belle is a B-17 World War II bomber, piloted by a young crew of ten men on dangerous bombing raids into Europe. Thus far they have flown 24 perilous missions, they are about to embark on mission 25 - a daylight raid on Bremen that is there most dangerous to date, and the one thing that stands between them and home. The expectations for success were high, as completing the 25th mission would earn the crew the prestigious position of being the first crew to complete all 25 missions in the 8th Airforce. Cinemagoers first saw the exploits of the Memphis Belle in a 1944 documentary by William Wyler (also available in the collection). Using this documentary as inspiration, the producers David Puttnam and Catherine Wyler embarked on a mission to produce a film that included real B-17’s and other vintage planes, as well as impressive models and authentic footage as a backdrop to the story of friendship, action and heroics. The cast includes Matthew Modine, Eric Stoltz, Tate Donovan, D. B. Sweeney, Billy Zane, Sean Astin, Harry Connick Jnr, Reed Edward Diamond, Coutney Gains and Neil Giuntoli.

results.title: Memory packs
results.brief_description:
This CD-ROM was created with funding by the Commonwealth Government through the Australia council - its arts and funding advisory body, and by the City of Port Philip Cultural Development Fund.
The work is an interactive exhibition of objects that evoke stories or memories. Young people, old people, people from diverse backgrounds, artists, entertainers, the famous, the infamous and the not yet discovered - all were asked to contribute an object of personal significance and a story to accompany it. The CD-ROM has a linked website (www.experimenta.org/gallery/memorypacks/description.html).

results.title: Memory of Moholy-Nagy
results.brief_description: An digitally animated journey through the abstract colors, compositions, and constructions of the Hungarian artist Laszlo Moholy-Nagy. Using 3D animation tools, the artist has created a landscape of the mind of this important 20th century artist.

results.title: Memory of Christmas: from 'Act One' by Moss Hart
results.brief_description: A series of dramatic photographs illustrates playwright Moss Hart’s grievously impoverished childhood. The text, adapted from Hart’s autobiography “Act one” describes two Christmases a generation apart illustrating the gap that existed between himself and his father and how that gap was finally bridged.

results.title: Memory lingers on (Episode 4)
results.brief_description: Illustrates some of the latest research into the workings of the brain. Examines the memory capacity of the brain and probes such questions as “Does memory remain the same over the years?”, “How does memory influence everyday actions”, and “Is the script for the future already written - from memory?” Also gives details of how external stimuli are processed by the brain.

results.title: Memory lingers on
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Colleen Johnson and ACMI
results.brief_description: Whether its in the eyes of her grandchild or the photos and memories of those loved and lost, Colleen Johnson feels a deep connection to her family. No matter what, they are her heart and soul.

results.title: Memory Garden
results.brief_description:
Filming ourselves and sharing the footage isn’t a modern phenomenon inspired by smart phones. It goes back to the first film in 1888 with Louis Le Prince’s ‘Roundhay Garden Scene’, a silent short of his family at home that demonstrates how we’ve always seen ourselves, friends and family as interesting subjects.

As advancements in technology led to more portable and affordable cameras, amateur filmmakers continued documenting their lives; capturing the everyday and extraordinary moments that moved and made us long before we were sharing selfies. These recorded memories have become an archive of our private lives and public history that preserves forgotten times, places and experiences.

constellations_primary.name: Making home movies
constellations_primary.description: Home movies have inspired the form and plots of narrative cinema.
